Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully cosy and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while passing through London on a leap year trip. I had gotten the recommendation from an Australian friend, and it turned out wonderfully! You get a lot for your money, considering you are in London, including FREE wifi! (unheard of!) and a FREE full breakfast! It's only about 30-45mins to get into central on the metro, and although not swanky, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The receptionists and waitress were exceptional. Very welcoming and friendly (especially compared to most london...) The girls were always welcoming if we came down to the lounge to watch tv and have a chat to ease our homesickness! Would recommend it to anyone looking to stay somewhere reasonable in London on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Abbey Lodge, Ealing, London”
Reviews.Author: elizag9
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Abbey Lodge in Ealing, West London during our visits to the UK for several years. We have tried other similarly priced hotels but the Abbey Lodge is definitely the best value for money. The location is perfect - set in a quiet residential area where one can have a full English breakfast (at no extra cost) while watching the squirrels and other wildlife in the garden;and just a 5-minute walk from the excellent shopping centre of Ealing and public transport - bus, train and underground. A short ride on the underground to get to Westfields, West End shops, theatres and attractions. Abbey Lodge has undergone redecoration and refurbishment since our previous visit. Rooms have tea & coffee making facilities and new flat screen tvs. The staff are very welcoming, always accommodating and keep the rooms beautifully clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: motherwellgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night having stayed at the sister hotel the previous week. 46 pounds for an en suite room. No complaints. Fabulous value for money, great location, you get what you pay for but I had no issues, got a great nights sleep and isn't the fanciest breakfast but enough to set you up for the day. I've paid more to stay in rooms the size of a cupboard in London. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: Scotsboy85
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times over the years and so have seen the improvements each time I come. Loving the addition of the small flatscreen freeview TVs ! It's basically an old victorian house converted so it has the foibles /quirks that go with it - the rooms seem to vary in size, so I've had the big rooms and the small ones but have to say, they are always clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff there are so friendly and helpful - happy to offer assistance with everythng from cabs to decent places to eat. A nice touch is the microwave in the breakfast room which meant I could bring my own meal in at night and heat it up - so the cost of eating out all the time was kept under control. I also found the free wi-fi useful too - unlike many of the bigger chains, there was no charge and it was reasonably stable. On the odd occasion it didn't connect, I just asked and they reset the router. It was also nice to see on this occasion the additions to the breakfast menu of yogurt and fresh fruit. I paid £46 for my room including breakfast and adding in the free wi-fi, I just feel that this is really good value for London. I was there just after the riots but I never felt unsafe at all and the locals seemed to have rallied round to get the shops/cafes affected up and running as quickly as possible and get back to normal. It's a nice part of London - like a small town - with the added benefit of being only 30 minutes from the centre, with some lovely parks in the area. No question that I'll be back next time I'm down.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tingeOz
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was included in the price and you could see why, one part was cold the other warm, the amount was tiny and didnt like the fact you are eating your breakfast near where people could smoke. The room was dirty with hairs on the bed, the floorboards had broken & you could have put your foot through the floor. The shower had hairs left in it, the shower was very poor no pressure and the doors were dirty. We didnt feel the staff we approachable, epsecially we didnt feel we could ask for anything at breakfast, too scared & were not told the times of breakfast & anything else about hotel. I think it sumed it up when we went to check out the ladt was smoking a fag and couldnt be bothered to get up to ask if everything was ok with the room & our stay, very rude would not stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay again”
Reviews.Author: jessiom
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed for 1 night for a concert, the hotel is ok, cheap, needs some update and maybe a good clean, our ensuite shower was very small about 3'x4' - if that! The young girl who greeted us was quite nice, the girl at breakfast was very rude, make sure you get to breakfast early or you get warmed up food, we had our toast taken away and told to leave as they wanted to clear the table!!!! Would never go again and would not advise anyone else to either! Sorry not the best place I have stayed, I am sure there are much better places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but we won't be back - don't expect much and make sure you get to breakfast in good time.”
Reviews.Author: Bonghi-bo
Reviews.Content: Nice enough area, close to tube, convenient for Wembley and Paddington Stations. We arrived around 2.30pm. When we rang the bell, a young lady came to the door and just looked at us (we announced ourselves) - no great welcome. We walked in and the carpet looked sticky and dirty. We were asked to pay upfront as we were only staying one night, but it was impossible to do a runner due to the amount of creaky floors. Toffees on the desk, a nice touch, but I was frightened to take one. The breakfast area was set for the next day and were covered in cloths - strange. We walked up 2 flights of well trodden stairs to our room. The skirting boards were dirty, there were cobwebs hanging off the ceiling and there was an area of water damage on the ceiling (worrying bluge), the top part of the net curtain was grimy black. The curtains were falling off the curtain rail, but just about kept the light out. The sheets smelt clean and the bathroom was clean enough, but I was worried I might get bites around my ankles. There is plenty of tea and coffee for use in the room. There is only anti bacterial handwash and showercaps in the bathroom. The worst thing, "breakfast "7am to 9am Mon - Fri" (pointed out with an apologetic smile). We arrived at a few minutes to 9am, the clock showed that it had gone past 9am. When we did not agree, we were told that we had to EAT by 9am (which I have never before encountered in my life) and "the problem is that all the food goes". Luckily for us, a few fellow guests backed us up and we had words with the young lady in charge, who was not very pleasant and served us breakfast. The girl who tried to send us away was clearing up and we had to ask for milk and butter. We were given rock hard reheated bacon and almost black sausage, the tomato was lovely and squishy, fresh fried egg and squidgy white toast. I have just looked at the photos advertised by the hotel, but they must have been taken around 20 to 30 years ago in a very good light and angle. I don't mind budget, but I expect clean and courteous. Â£58 for a twin room is not that cheap. We had a good time and had a laugh about the B&B, but the treatment we received at breakfast time was the last straw.

Reviews.Title: “Homely place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EamonOD
Reviews.Content: Stay here for two weeks as part of a move to Ealing. It's a homely spot located minutes from the main hustle and bustle of Ealing braodway and tucked away in a resedential area close to tube into central London. Well ran, easy going and worth a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Quite adequate and economic for business needs”
Reviews.Author: haydp
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel was quite suitable for my needs. Management is responsive and desk staff are helpful. The free wireless Internet has improved and VPN block should now be lifted as a result of my request to management, who wasn't aware of VPN but quickly got a positive response from his IT consultant. Momentary Internet dropouts are happening and management showed concern and promised to investigate. The breakfast is free and all you can eat. The room is clean enough, and guests need to remember that if you pay more you can get more, but all your core needs are provided here in a quiet street. Lunch and dinner is a 200 metre walk to the food outlets. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: KentMuffet
Reviews.Content: My initial contact via email was positive, my contact was pleasant and helpful. I need to stay one night a week in London whilst I attend a course. My first night, I was taken aback at how shabby the room was , smelled of mould and moth balls. I didn't really want my things to touch anything, but having arrived at 10.30 p.m, decided not to be so precious and went to bed. The lady serving breakfast next morning redeemed the whole experience, she was so lovely and friendly. The next week, I again arrived as arranged at 10p.m and went to my room, to discover that the bed linen was not clean - the bed had been made up, but I am one hundred percent certain that the sheets had been used before. There were hairs in the bed and creases which only bodies make - I don't want to go into it. I went and found a girl who was doing laundry and she gave me another room, which was similar to my first nights experience. I emailed next day to say I would not be staying again, as NO WAY is that acceptable. No apology, nothing. DON'T STAY THERE is my advice!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly enough staff, but its just not clean”
Reviews.Author: jqsmooth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early September as the place looks good on the website and we needed somewhere fairly quickly. Parking is a premium, and there is really only two spaces for the whole place. Otherwise you may be parked in by residents who can park in front. Check in was ok if not a little but short. Then we went to the "recently refurbished" room, which was room 1. At the back of the hotel, so nice and quiet, overlooking the small garden which was pleasant. But its just not clean. The toilet has mess on the bowl from the previous tenant, and close look behind the seats revealed a disgusting yellow mess. The bathroom was floored with disgusting black temporary lino, the sink has cracks in it, and the shower has not been cleaned but rather has been grouted over the moudly mess they cannot be bothered to scrub off properly. The wallpaper was coming off in parts, and there was visible damp with some mould underneath the TV that doesnt really receive much in the way of TV (it has rabbit ears, no roof antenna here). The carpet was dirty, and there was dust on almost every surface. Just run your finger along it, staff, its not hard. No matress protectors either... disgusting. These are the easiest way to prevent contamination. Wifi worked fine, which was great for finding somewhere else for the next week. The breakfast staff were great, and the food was quickly prepared and nice. I couldnt help but laugh at their constant references to Fawlty Towers though! So if cleanliness is something you expect from a lodging, this is not the place for you. It needs new cleaning staff, some paintwork, and new carpets, and in essence they need to actually "completey refurbish" as they promise they did in 2009. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Redcrow
Reviews.Content: This was the biggest dissapointment of our entire England trip. We had stayed at the Grange Lodge, owned by the same company, and it was fine. It was basic, but clean and had good staff. The Abbey was a disaster in comparison. The staff was unprofessional and unhelpful--wouldn't show us to our room or help with the bags, couldn't get our breakfast order straight (and it wasn't busy, but his dolly bird couldn't remember a thing!). The carpet was filthy--hadn't been vacuumed or hoovered in months. The floor of the ensuite bathroom was filthy black plastic industrial matting, nailed over rotting floorboards. The shower was mildewed, then someone had smeared caulking over the mildew with all the skill of a 3 year old in finger painting class--and then had mended the door track with duct tape. Repairs are being done by amateurs, not by skilled trades people. The toilet was cracked, the sink was dirty and so tiny it was hard to get both hands in it. The bed sheets looked clean, but had holes in them, but the pillow cases were not clean--someone's black hair was all over them (and neither of us had black hair!). And...the wardrobe was bashed in on one side. The television had rabbit ears and the wi-fi didn't work beyond the ground floor. The room was so tiny I couldn' believe it. It's really a single that they're marketing as a double. Oh, and the lounge was decorated by the Salvation Army. This place needs serious structural remodeling, not just new curtains and bed spreads. The floors creak and groan every place you walk--they feel like they're going to give way any time. I think a building inspector would condem it. It also needs staff who know how to run a hotel, and how to CLEAN a hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jennymacHull
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Abbey Lodge with my partner and my parents for 2 nights, we had a friendly welcome from Natalie who checked us in. We had booked 2 doubles, we was put in room 17 on the ground floor which was a spacious tripple. The room itself was very clean with a tv and tea making facilities. The bathroom was ok, not 5 star but for Â£53 a night more than adequate. The rooms where warm, clean and the bed comfy. There was no noise during the night and the breakfast was lovely, with a choice of cereal or a full english. The B&B is a 10 minute walk to the tube station and around the corner is a great pub serving great food.

Reviews.Title: “good service and breakfast, clean room, though a little small”
Reviews.Author: apm35
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay here and am horrified to read the other reviews. It doesnt sound like the same place at all. The date of my stay and the other reviews show that I got the benefit of the refurbishment that one of the reviews mentions. My room was clean (not sparkling, but ok) but a bit on the small side. However, it was ok for my needs. The hotel generally looked a little worn but not shabby. I suppose they must have spruced it up. The furniture in the room was a bit cheap and could do with some more updating, but this is a very minor point. Also, there was heating and it was very efficient. In fact I had to get them to turn it off, it was so hot. So that looks like its another problem fixed. I was very pleased with the service. The staff were very helpful and polite and even managed to get me a downstairs room when initially none were available. This was handy for me because my leg was in a cast at the time. Breakfast was quite good and when there was a small problem with an undercooked sausage they replaced it right away with no arguments. I'm sure there are problem in the best of places so the acid test as far as I am concerned is how the staff deal with any issues. I was very pleased. The internet access was a breeze to set up, worked straight away and was very fast. And it's free. From my experience I have to conclude that all the problems mentioned in the other reviews must have been fixed now. It was not a brilliant stay but I was happy and it is at the cheap end of the market. I am pleased with the level of service too, so if I get stranded in Ealing again and need to be in the office the next day I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: munchee
Reviews.Content: staff grumpy and unfriendly,could not open front door and bedroom with key very hard when approached staff about key she was very rude and abrupt eventually found other key but just as bad .Room dingy no heatingfreezing cold all night ,bed very uncomfortable matress has had it, crumbs on carpet sheets did not look very clean wondered if had been changed? bathroom not very good standard no bath shower not very clean mould and black bits in it did not dare use it for fear of catching something,sink much too small when washing water goes everywhere and the floor gets wet and very slippery,toilet though clean the seat badly worn ,did not have breakfast here for fear of the same conditions in kitchen and fear of contracting something nasty only spent one night here the worst night ever did not sleep much at all could not wait to leave would not recommend to anyone and will definately not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about it....AVOID.”
Reviews.Author: Kreely
Reviews.Content: If you value your comfort, dont even consider staying near this place at all. I booked the hotel due to its location, close to the conference i was attending, and now regretting not reading the reviews 1st. The place is old, dirty dingy and unkept. The whole building creaks even with the wind(not an exageration). Its so noisy, the floors and doors creak everytime and the rooms must be separated by paper. I could hear the guy next room 1st speaking on his phone, then eating(yes i heard the clang of cutlery on plates) and finally snoring all through the night. I woke up suddenly at 3am to a loud bang(sounded like a bomb) only to find out it was the front door being closed/jammed by someone. It was a disastrous stay. Please and please, dont make the mistake even if its for free.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: loobyloo77
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I could tell as soon as I walked through the door that this was going to be a trial. The owner (or whoever the woman was that opened the door) was very unwelcoming. The room was dingy and although I didn't want to touch the bed, I knew I had to sleep somewhere. It was like lying on a bag of rocks - my back will never recover! The bathroom was full of mould, mildew and rust. I didn't want to eat breakfast in the morning, but as I was hungry, I opted for the cereal (it was the only thing that looked safe). If you do want to stay in London, maybe the monkey enclosure at London Zoo might be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: Jemmy77
Reviews.Content: I feel stupid writing a review now after staying at such a filthy hotel. should have checked the reviews before making the booking. Staff is most unhelpful, rooms are smelly, dusty, bed terrible to sleep in. Had to check out and find another hotel in desperation. Dont even think about staying there unless all the hotels in whole of London have refused you a place.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby.”
Reviews.Author: maltababy
Reviews.Content: The only reason I would consider stopping here again is if the only other alternative was to sleep on the side of the road. Infact I lie I would rather sleep on the side of a road!! Room was in desparate need of a re-furb. The bathroom floor was covered in 'black' lino ( god only knows what that was hiding)!! Breakfast was included in the price, which might not have been so bad if the milk hadn't smelt worse than the room ( the smell of burnt toast couldn't mask it!!) The final straw came when my daughter needed to use the 'public loo' during breakfast, it was disgusting - the floor hadn't seen a mop in months judging by the amount of fluff and dust around the edges of the floor. Didn't stop for the second night of our stay, we booked in at the Ramada (just around the corner). This cost us Â£16 more for the night and was a 100 times better. Unfortunately on this occasion 'big -chain' beat 'small local'!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had the missfortune of staying here for one night after a party. It was dirty, drab, lounge (didn't venture) but looked uncomfortable, kitchen grotty, breakfast room grotty, breakfast awful, cooked by slovenly staff in their pyjamas and bare feet and to top it all the girlfriend woke up covered in bites!! Makes me ashamed to be English.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Martowski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the last night we were in England. We had stayed at another hotel in London (Abbey House) for a week, traveled the countryside for a week, and then came back to London for our last night. First off, Abbey Lodge is not in a very tourist-friendly part of town. There isn't much to do in this area for tourists, and the area seems "tired" and a little run down. The house itsself is average. Our room was very tiny, dingy, and the sheets appeared to not have been washed since the last occupants of the room. The floors of the bathroom were an instituional-feeling rubber. The breakfast was edible, but you get a full view of the not so clean kitchen where food is being made (doesn't help the appetite). The staff in the morning appeared to be "lounging around" in their pajamas, which wasn't very appealing to me. I would not stay here again, and would not recommend this to others.

HotelInfo.Name: Abbey Lodge Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 51 Grange Park | Ealing, London W5 3PR, England
